summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from July 2019 discussing coordination between FBI offices in New York and St. Thomas (U.S. Virgin Islands) regarding the Jeffrey Epstein case. The emails focus on monitoring Epstein's private jet, potential arrest warrant coordination, and sharing information about leads, witnesses, and addresses.

persons.name: Gonzalez
persons.context: Appears as an FBI agent (email address ggonzalez4@fbi.gov) copied on the email chain discussing Epstein case coordination.

events.title: FBI NY requests airport surveillance for Epstein's jet
events.description: An FBI agent from the New York office emails the St. Thomas FBI office requesting they quietly spot check the airport for Jeffrey Epstein's private jet.

events.title: FBI St. Thomas offers assistance on Epstein case
events.description: An FBI agent from the St. Thomas office responds, offering to assist with leads, interviews, witnesses, and addresses, noting familiarity with Epstein in the U.S. Virgin Islands.

keyFacts: The FBI New York office was actively coordinating with the FBI St. Thomas office regarding Jeffrey Epstein in July 2019.
The FBI New York office specifically requested the St. Thomas FBI to 'quietly spot check the airport for Epstein's private jet'.
The FBI St. Thomas office indicated they were 'very familiar with your subject in the U.S. Virgin Islands', suggesting prior investigative knowledge of Epstein's activities there.
The emails reference an ongoing status for an arrest warrant for Epstein and potential law enforcement action needing coordination.
The correspondence shows inter-office FBI collaboration focused on surveillance and investigative support related to Epstein's travel and presence in the U.S. Virgin Islands.
